Title: 700 - Glueing 1D Shapes to 2D Shapes
Description: 1D and 2D 'Glue' will adjust other shapes as a result of moving the selected shape
Tip: 1D Glue requires the shape to reference another. Do this through an intermediary object the links the source and target.

Summary.What: When the target shape is moved, other shapes that own the 'glue' to it must be notified and modified.
Summary.Why: 1D shapes must adjust there position and orientation to stay connected in the diagram.
Summary.How: let the 1D shape own the glue, then notify the glue every time the target shapes is moved so it can adjust the 1D shape.

Samples.Tip: Cache invalidation  (Smashing), the concept that make it all work
